Detailed Description

template<typename P, template< typename, typename > class VP = std::vector, template< typename, typename > class VR = std::vector, template< typename > class AP = std::allocator, template< typename > class AR = std::allocator>
class geometry::polygon< P, VP, VR, AP, AR >

The polygon contains an outer ring and zero or more inner rings.

Template parameters:
  • P point type
  • VR optional container type for inner rings, for example std::vector, std::list, std::deque
  • VP optional container type for points, for example std::vector, std::list, std::deque
  • AR container-allocator-type
  • AP container-allocator-type
Note:
The container collecting the points in the rings can be different from the container collecting the inner rings. They all default to vector.
Examples:

4_polygon_example.cpp, and 6_transformation_example.cpp.
